course_title: Contextual Education Elective: Methods of Social and Congregational Analysis
class_notes: (THIS COURSE IS FULL; contact candlerregistrar@emory.edu to request to be placed on the waiting list) (Same as CC 515CEE 1) (ONLINE: synchronous live sessions Wednesday 1:00pm-2:30pm; remaining contact time fulfilled via asynchronous online engagement) (Concurrent enrollment in CE 552A or any level of teaching parish or EASP Con Ed required; permission number required to enroll; request permission by emailing candlerregistrar@emory.edu beginning Monday, March 21, 2022)
course_description: Contextual Education Elective course for student in Con Ed II, Teaching Parish II or EASP II. provides students an introduction to methods of contextual analysis and the opportunity to conduct an analysis of their context of ministry, be it a congregation, community, or community organization. Students will be encouraged to develop a multidimensional lens that provides a framework for critical reflection on the theological, sociological, and cultural dimensions of ministry in their setting.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 5159, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 1-2:30p, Instructor: M. Frederick, Status: Closed
